content:
Calculate the mean and standard deviation for the following data using [ Python code ]:
temperatures = [8, 4, 7, 7, 5, 2, 10]
To calculate the mean, you can use the following code:
mean = sum(temperatures) / len(temperatures)
To calculate the standard deviation, you can use the following code:
import math
mean = sum(temperatures) / len(temperatures)
deviations = [(x - mean) ** 2 for x in temperatures]
standard_deviation = math.sqrt(sum(deviations) / (len(deviations)-1))

Certainly! Below is the complete Python code to calculate the mean and standard deviation of the given data:

```python
import math

# List of temperatures
temperatures = [8, 4, 7, 7, 5, 2, 10]

# Calculate the mean
mean = sum(temperatures) / len(temperatures)

# Calculate the deviations from the mean and then the standard deviation
deviations = [(x - mean) ** 2 for x in temperatures]
standard_deviation = math.sqrt(sum(deviations) / (len(deviations) - 1))

# Print the results
print("Mean:", mean)
print("Standard Deviation:", standard_deviation)
```

When you run this code, it will output the mean and standard deviation for the temperature data list.
